[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Grid 3D defines requirements for a scientific visualization tool enabling efficient 3D data exploration and analysis.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: Grid 3D supports 3D visualization, grid manipulation, and interactive exploration for research.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: Grid 3D integrates with visualization tools and sensors for structured input.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: Grid 3D provides an interactive 3D dashboard with zoom, rotation, and selection.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: Grid 3D operates on personal computers with keyboard and mouse input.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: Grid 3D is compatible with Matlab for preprocessing and deploys via Tomcat/Apache.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: Grid 3D supports datasets up to a few thousand points.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: Grid 3D supports real-time 3D plotting, zooming, rotating, and grid modifications.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: Grid 3D integrates with Matlab, Apache, and scientific tools.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: Grid 3D enables 3D plotting, dynamic labeling, zooming, and data exploration.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: Grid 3D supports researchers, students, and analysts.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: Grid 3D requires compatible OS, hardware, and data formats.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: Grid 3D assumes Matlab, Tomcat, and supported hardware availability.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Cluster Title: Groups data points by attributes.
[SUBSEC] 1.9 Acronyms and Abbreviations: NIMR: National Institute for Medical Research

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall accept structured text files.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall generate interactive 3D visualizations.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall plot data points using user-defined parameters (REQ-INTF-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall label axes based on dataset headers (REQ-INTF-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall allow grid rotation, zoom, and movement.
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-004: The system shall enable multiple point selection for analysis (REQ-FUNC-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide intuitive grid controls and point selection (REQ-FUNC-003).

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall respond to zoom, rotation, and selection inputs without significant delay (REQ-FUNC-003).

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store user grid settings for future sessions (REQ-FUNC-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-002: The system shall maintain metadata records for traceability (REQ-FUNC-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall be compatible with Windows and Linux (REQ-INTF-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with scientific visualization standards.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall maintain 99% reliability during visualization (REQ-PERF-001).

[SEC] 3. Verification: Functional and performance tests shall validate plotting, labeling, and grid manipulation.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User manuals, configuration guides, and sample datasets.
[SEC] 5. References: Grid 3D Design Documents, Matlab Integration Guidelines, Apache Deployment Instructions.
